The RFN Config Notification Test simulates RFN Config Notification messages from RFN nodes to Porter.
Substation bus kWh value must be greater than 0.
Bank kVar for 1v Local Voltage Change
Bank kVar for .2v Remote Voltage Change

The IVVC Simulator generates kW, kVar, and Voltage point values for any area whose name begins with "Sim Area". It will adjust voltages based on Taps and adjust kVar based on open and closed banks in order to make IVVC work properly. In the standard case the kW follows a set sinusoidal pattern throughout a single day, peaking at 6pm. The kVar follows the kW. Increased Speed Mode will cause this pattern to cycle in a shorter time period to enable better demonstration and testing. When a substation bus's name begins with "Backfed" a voltage shift from a solar generation source will be simulated on the line
This file does not exist at {0}
• File name: File name of existing file located at {0}. Provide file name with extension (.csv)
Group Name should be more than 1 less than 3
Rows and No of Thermostat cannot be blank

• Group Name: Comma separated list of group names. Minimum 1 and maximum 3 group names are allowed.
  • Rows: Number of rows to generate in the file.
  • Number of thermostats: maximum number of thermostats per account, the generated serial numbers will be random up to the maximum number. Example: 2 thermostats, the row might have 1 or 2 serial numbers.
  • Winter Program: If checked the file will indicate that all thermostats are under the a "winter" program otherwise it will be under the "summer" program.
  • Use this file for nest: Set generated file as file to use when working with Nest.

• Sync button: Sync Yukon and Nest.
  • Download existing file: Download file from nest/yukon. Value of Global Setting -> Demand Response -> Nest API URL decide from where the file will be downloaded. To use yukon instead of nest, set the URL as: http://localhost:8080/yukon/dev/nestApi. If you are not using the /yukon application context (like QA), it should be set to http://localhost:8080/dev/nestApi.
Stop date cannot be less than start date

The Control Event Generation section simulates responses that we get from Nest when starting, stopping or canceling an event/program. Set the control parameters that you would like to test and click on Send Event to Simulate sending an event to Nest. The response that is returned will display in the Response section. If an Event ID is displayed, it was successful, otherwise it will display an error code. You can then simulate stopping/canceling the event by clicking on the corresponding button.

The Error Generation section simulates errors that we receive from Nest. Select the error that you would like to simulate when Starting, Stopping or Cancelling a program/event and click on Set Error to save the settings. You can then start/stop/cancel a program/event to simulate the error.

It's dangerous to go alone! Take this.
All your base are belong to us.

The Device Group Generator Tool generates device groups based on the below mentioned parameters:
  • Number of device groups to be created
  • Number of devices to be placed in each group
  • Whether nested groups are required(Yes/No)
  • Group can contain either LCRs or MCT devices
The nested groups option would simply create nested composed groups in the form of a binary tree.

Bulk Import File Generator tool generates two files based on selected group:
  • First file contains modification in Device name and Meter number as per Append text input.This file can be used in bulk import for testing purposes.
  • Second file is having no changes in it. This file can be further used to revert changes caused by above file.

This tool is designed to insert point data directly (not via Dispatch) to the database for selected device group. Tool can insert below point values for all devices in the selected device group.
  • Analog
  • Status
  • KWh
Period will divide the entire start-stop range into intervals. Value High/Low are upper and lower values for Analog points.

RFN Meter Simulator tool generates the read archive requests with the point data for the existing all RFN meter device types or the chosen RFN meter types, as per the Reporting interval selected.
The duplicate read archive request will be generated as per the percentage of duplicity mentioned while starting the simulator.

This simulator is designed to mock the functionality of the network manager in respect to sending and receiving messages along with the generation of meter data. It functions in a similar manner to the NM Gateway Simulator pertaining to activating and deactivating simulators.

Current Simulators:

  • Read Simulator - When running, it will simulate an NM response when reading an RFN Meter in Yukon via reading on the Meter Readings widget or through a Collection Action.
  • Disconnect Simulator - When running, it will simulate an NM response when changing the connection status of an RFN Meter in Yukon via disconnecting on the Disconnect widget or through a Collection Action.

This page is used for testing an sftp server. The example is populated with a public test server. Please visit https://www.wftpserver.com/onlinedemo.htm for further details
